glossentry.glossdef: A cylindrical component in the engine that moves up and down within the cylinder bore, converting the force from expanding gases during combustion into mechanical motion. The piston was made of cast iron and featured three piston rings to ensure proper sealing within the cylinder.

glossBody.glossUsage: The term is commonly used in automotive repair manuals and parts catalogs specific to the , manufactured from 1908 to 1927.
glossBody.glossScopeNote: Applies specifically to the piston used in the 's 177 cubic inch (2.9 L) four-cylinder engine.

glossSymbol.alt: Standard automotive symbol for piston in technical diagrams
